definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

sentences.english: EVERY evening the young Fisherman went out upon the sea, and threw his nets into the water.
sentences.chinese: 每晚，年輕的漁夫都要出海打魚，將他的網撒進水裏。

sentences.english: The company dismissed first those who were fast and loose with their work.
sentences.chinese: 公司首先開除了那些三天打魚，兩天曬網的人。

sentences.english: 2he saw at the water's edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets.
sentences.chinese: 他見有兩隻船灣在湖邊，打魚的人卻離開船洗網去了。

sentences.english: Can we go fishing with you?
sentences.chinese: 我們可以跟你們一起去打魚嗎？

sentences.english: Tom was enrolled as a student, but he was like the fisherman who fishes for three days and suns his net for two.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆也來上學，不過是三天打魚，兩天曬網。

sentences.english: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon.
sentences.chinese: 講完了，對西門說，把船開到水深之處，下網打魚。

sentences.english: When young, she used to go fishing with her grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 小時侯她常隨爺爺去打魚。

sentences.english: Sir, can we go fishing with you?
sentences.chinese: 師傅，我們可以跟你們一起去打魚嗎？

sentences.english: One day, there was a fishing net in the ditch to live a small snake.
sentences.chinese: 一天，有個打魚人在水溝裏網住了一條小蛇。

sentences.english: The fisherman poled a boat and went fishing on the lake.
sentences.chinese: 漁夫撐船離岸，到湖裏打魚去了。

sentences.english: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
sentences.chinese: 講完了，對西門說，把船開到水深之處，下網打魚。

sentences.english: I went on living in the hut when he died, and went on fishing.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他死了，我還住在那個木房裏，繼續打魚。

sentences.english: I am going to fish together with them.
sentences.chinese: 我要跟他們一塊兒去打魚。

definition: to catch fish/(fig.) to loaf on the job/to be slack/to take it easy
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to go to market/to go to a fair
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
to fish with a hook and bait
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
